Karnamrta Krishna Dasa
postsData.content:
Know that God is working behind the scenes for our good, even when what is happening on the stage doesnâ€™t seem to be good.

A fundamental truth of spirituality is that there is much more to reality than what meets the eye. Guided by spiritual knowledge, we understand that, bigger than the visible material reality, no matter how grand it may seem, is the invisible spiritual reality. And in that spiritual realm reigns supreme the all-loving, all-attractive divinity, Krishna, the greatest well-wisher of all living beings.

We may conceptually understand God as the greatest reality in terms of the structure of things, yet we often forget that this truth applies not only to the structure but also to the workings of things. God is not a distant being, content in his supremacy and unconcerned with what happens elsewhere. Instead, he is active, working behind the scenes, moving the world and all living beings toward ultimate auspiciousness. As the Bhagavad-gita (9.10) declares, the Lord oversees the movements of material nature.

My Mentorâ€™s $100 test left me speechless, and it might change how you see yourself forever

She pulled out a crisp $100 bill and asked:
"Do you want this?"
Of course, I said yes.

Then she crumpled it up.
"Still want it?"
Yes.

Then she threw it on the floor, stomped on it, and picked it up again.
"Still want it?"
Obviously.

Then she looked me straight in the eye and said something that shook me to my core:

â€œThen why do you let failure, rejection, or someoneâ€™s opinion make you forget your worth?â€

That moment was a wake-up call.
Read this twice:

- A rejection email doesnâ€™t erase your talent.
- A bad day doesnâ€™t define your future.
- No one (not a boss, a client, or a stranger) gets to decide your worth.

Life will stomp on you. People will doubt you.
But none of that changes who you are.
Stand tall. Move forward. Own your worth!

PS: If you had to give one piece of advice to someone struggling with self-doubt right now, what would it be?

postsData.content:
Hangman Game with Python & Tkinter 
I recently developed a simple yet fun Hangman Game using Python and Tkinter for the graphical user interface. This game allows users to guess a randomly selected word letter by letter. With a visually appealing design and interactive gameplay, itâ€™s a great way to practice coding while enjoying a classic word-guessing game.

Key Features:
1) Random Word Selection: Picks a random word from a predefined list.
2) Dynamic Display: Shows underscores for unguessed letters, and updates in real-time as the player makes correct guesses.
3) Guess Tracking: Keeps track of guessed letters, with a limit on the number of incorrect guesses.
4) Message Alerts: Provides feedback on each guess (correct, incorrect, or already guessed).
5) Interactive UI: Built with Tkinter, featuring an intuitive layout with an input field for user guesses, chances left, and real-time game messages.
Game Reset: Includes a button to restart the game once it's over.

Tools Used:
1) Python
2) Tkinter (GUI)

This project not only helped me improve my skills with Python but also gave me a deeper understanding of game logic, user interaction, and GUI design.
And I would like to thank my mentor Gaurav sir for helping me and giving me a proper guidance on this project
Thank You

postsData.content:
Imagine walking into work one day and sensing an eerie quietnessâ€”fewer colleagues in meetings, budgets tightening, and whispered conversations behind closed doors. Are these signs of layoff?

Layoffs are unsettling but often predictable if you know where to look.

Companies facing financial struggles or strategic shifts exhibit clear warning signs long before pink slips arrive.


Here are a few red flags that you need to look out for

1. Hiring and Spending Freezes: The First Alarm Bell
When a company stops hiring or freezes discretionary spending (delay major investments), it signals financial uncertainty or a shift in priorities.

This preventive approach allows companies to control costs without immediately resorting to layoffs. However, if the situation worsens, a hiring freeze is often the precursor to more drastic cuts.


2. Executive Departures and Internal Restructuring
When key executives exit or teams undergo sudden reorganization, it often signals instability, internal disagreements about the companyâ€™s direction and impending workforce reductions.

Simultaneously, restructuring efforts designed to â€œstreamline operationsâ€ may disguise downsizing efforts.

Executive changes often precede layoffs, as new leadership may implement cost-cutting strategies that impact headcount.

If leadership changes and restructuring werenâ€™t enough, employees should pay special attention to company-wide meetings that appear out of nowhere.


3. The Dreaded Company-Wide Meeting: An Ominous Sign
An unexpected, urgent all-hands meeting often precedes major announcementsâ€”frequently layoffs or restructuring plans.

History has shown that sudden company-wide meetings, especially those led by top executives, rarely bring good news. Employees are often briefed on â€œnew directions,â€ â€œtough decisions,â€ or â€œnecessary adjustmentsâ€â€”all coded language for impending job losses.

These meetings usually serve as the final step before layoffs are announced, confirming suspicions raised by hiring freezes, executive departures, and restructuring. If such a meeting is scheduled, employees should prepare their rÃ©sumÃ©s and explore contingency plans.


Understanding these signals can help employees act proactively rather than being caught off guard when layoffs become a reality.While layoffs may seem sudden, they are often preceded by unmistakable warning signs.

Employees should remain alert to hiring and spending freezes, executive exits, internal restructuring, and unexpected company-wide meetings. Each of these signals offers an opportunity to prepare, whether through upskilling, job searching, or networking.

Rather than waiting for bad news, professionals should stay vigilant, read between the lines, and take control of their career trajectory before layoffs become a reality.

Use these tips to stay secure while making the most of your LinkedIn experience!

 Tip 1: Customize Your Profile Visibility
Control who can see your connections, activity, and contact information. Adjust your privacy settings so only trusted individuals can access sensitive details. For example, limit profile visibility to â€œConnections Onlyâ€ for added security.

 Tip 2: Be Selective with Endorsements and Recommendations
Only accept endorsements and recommendations from people youâ€™ve worked with directly. This ensures your profile remains credible and avoids association with potentially fake or untrustworthy accounts.

 Tip 3: Verify Job Offers and Recruiters
Before responding to job offers or recruiter messages, research the company and individual. Check their LinkedIn activity, shared connections, and online presence to confirm legitimacy. Scammers often pose as recruiters to collect personal information.

 Tip 4: Avoid Sharing Sensitive Work Details
Refrain from posting confidential company information, project specifics, or proprietary data on your profile or in updates. This protects both your employer and your professional reputation.

 Tip 5: Regularly Audit Your Connections
Periodically review your LinkedIn connections and remove any that seem suspicious or irrelevant. Keeping a curated network helps maintain the quality of your professional relationships.

 Tip 6: Monitor Login Activity
Use LinkedInâ€™s tools to check recent login activity on your account. If you notice logins from unfamiliar locations or devices, update your password immediately and enable two-factor authentication (2FA).

 Tip 7: Be Wary of Suspicious Messages
If someone sends you a message asking for personal information or offering unrealistic opportunities, proceed with caution. Avoid clicking on links or downloading attachments unless youâ€™re confident theyâ€™re safe.

 Tip 8: Stay Updated on Security Practices
Regularly review LinkedInâ€™s security resources to stay informed about new features or potential threats. Being proactive about learning best practices keeps you one step ahead of cyber risks.

 Tip 9: Limit Third-Party App Access
Check which apps are connected to your LinkedIn account and revoke access for any that are unnecessary or unfamiliar. This reduces the risk of unauthorized data sharing.

 Tip 10: Report Suspicious Profiles or Activity
If you encounter fake profiles, phishing attempts, or inappropriate behavior, report them to LinkedIn immediately. Your actions can help protect others in the community from similar risks.

postsData.content:
Something humbled me this week. I don't know if it will have the same effect on you but I'll let you decide.


As we embarked into our daily journey into the Word, I found myself explaining Psalm 3:3 to my children.


For thou, oh Lord, art a shield for me. You are my glory and the lifter of my head. 


Imagine me having to explain that David wrote this when he was running away from his son Absalom who was trying to kill him and take the throne - talk about wahala pro max...


But that not the humbling part. This is 


Imagine a soldier without a shield in the heat of the battle  That soldier is going to be hit soon!


A shield is a protective gear in warfare. David said that's who God is to him.


Unlike every other gear, a shield (and a sword) are two gears you have to be intentional in carrying and positioning.


Sometimes, the shield looks like a burden that many soldiers abandon it in the heat of battle. Some soldiers, Like Goliath of Gath, even employ others to carry it for them - remember how he ended up.


 This week, will you be intentional about putting God in His position in your life?


 Are you so busy in the midst of the battle that you have placed your shield aside and you are now fighting bare chested? This is where many Christian are. They believe God, they profess love but their hearts are far from him!


 Have you employed others to carry your shield for you - Relying on only the Sunday sermon and content creators to feed you - but no real personal and consistent relationship with God?


PS: Before I go, let me take it a notch deeper. This shield is our faith with which we quench the fiery darts of the devil.


Our faith is noth just a general idea of the existence of God. Rather, it is the position of our heart in the relevance of God as tackle our daily situations.


When you really believe that He exists and His word is true and infallible, you express it in the way you tackle doubts, fear, worry, challenges etc. Do you allow these darts penetrate or do you use your shield?


It is also evident in how you treat your successes. It's sometimes easy to turn to God in the midst of challenges and forget all about Him when things run smoothly Selah.


PS: Did you learn something? Share with me in comments.

==============================


Is knowing more about God and your purpose here on earth a priority for you in 2025?


Join me @and I will hold your hands as you grow in your knowledge of God.

Are you moving with your season or fighting against it?

postsData.content:
PLM Has Failed to Deliver on Product Dataâ€”Whatâ€™s Next?

For decades, PLM promised to manage and deliver product data, but the reality has fallen short. Organizations still struggle with fragmented, inaccessible information, making digital continuity a challenge. The technological shift to a Product Knowledge Graph changes the gameâ€”bringing a new paradigm for structuring, linking, and leveraging product data across the enterprise.

 Why PLM Has Failed on Product Data:
 Data silos: PLM systems lock data inside rigid structures, making integration difficult.
 Poor accessibility: Engineering, manufacturing, and supply chain teams struggle to access the right data when they need it.
 Complexity overload: Monolithic PLM implementations become bloated, costly, and hard to maintain.
 Lack of flexibility: PLM struggles to adapt to modern data models, digital threads, and AI-driven insights.
 Disconnected workflows: PLM often fails to bridge the gap between design, procurement, and production.

The Product Knowledge Graph offers a new paradigmâ€”structuring, linking, and leveraging product data across the enterprise for better decision-making and efficiency.

How can your organization finally get the product data it needs?

Read more:  Helping Your Organization Get Product Data [link in the comment]

They all sound and look the same. The format and spacing is identical, the sentence structures are similar, with emoji placements in the same places. Itâ€™s pretty obvious.

The biggest mistake you can make is to try and build a personal brand with AI generated content. It will have the opposite effectâ€”youâ€™ll commoditize yourself.

What to do instead: Use AI to do research, come up with ideas, and refine your work, but write in your raw, authentic voice.

postsData.content:
BIOMIMICRY CONTINUUM â€“ Part 5 â€“ CURATING Agentic Expertise
Multidisciplinary expertise is critical to correctly define the key premises driving problem analysis and solution architecture, and the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem (left image) enables capturing that expertise as a reusable computing asset.

The current AI chaos is due to 70 years of narrow and unexamined premises. The promise of AGI in the 1950s was rooted in premises that have been disproven by real-world evidence but blindly adhered to by those making todayâ€™s AGI claims. Key examples:

-Premise: language is the source of intelligence
-Reality: intelligence is the source of language - babies are intelligent before they can speak

-Premise: data is a representation of the real world
-Reality: data is the output of a machine and represents only what the machine was designed to capture

-Premise: the brain constructs objects by identifying frequent patterns of object bits
-Reality: the brain contains networks of abstract concept cells which fire when the concepts are presented in diverse versions and formats (text, image, sound, etc.)

-Premise: neural networks imitate how the brain reasons by processing massive data exhaustively
-Reality: the brain computes the relevance of inputs using inhibition networks, filtering out over 99.99% of sensory data

There are more, but the point is that the main objectives of curation are:
1-Ensure that knowledge from all relevant domains is included in the ontology
2-Map the relevant knowledge concepts across the domains to problem and solution concepts
3-Maintain the landscape concepts (science, business, regulation, etc.) reasonably updated

To enable these objectives, the custodian systems must support:
1-Biomimetic digital twinning of problem and solution concepts
2-Independent update by authorized experts
2-Simulation and testing of the impact of proposed updates across the ontology architecture

The methodology and technology to build this type of biomimetic digital twin ecosystem exist, we have produced published results, and I have discussed this in my posts.

The vision of the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem in the image, however, is in early stages and will require committed partners with the necessary resources who want to participate in shaping the implementation of this new paradigm.
postsData.commentAdded: Insightful perspective! Embracing multidisciplinary expertise is crucial for advancing AGI. Excited to see where this journey leads! #Innovation

Thereâ€™s a leadership lesson hiding in my sonâ€™s castle bed.

(Itâ€™s not about climbing ladders.)

My 8-year-old screams for rescue from his â€˜castle bedâ€™ every morning.
Now we conquer dragons and pancake batter instead.

Hereâ€™s the mindset shift that rewrote our routineâ€¦

For months, my sonâ€™s top-floor bunk was a daily crisis zone.
Saturday 6:30 AM: â€œPAPÃ€Ã€Ã€!!â€
Iâ€™d groan, get myself up the ladder, and start the day drained.

Then I realized: How we start our mornings affects how we show up for everything else.

How to change that?
Instead of treating it as a chore, we turned it into a ritual.

Now, when he calls, I shout back: â€œComing! Do you choose to start with an adventure or breakfast today?â€

Some days, we read about how Sinner has become a great tennis player.
Others, we raid the kitchen to make pancakes for the family.

The coaching lesson hiding in our castle chaos:
Resistance often comes from unmet needs, not defiance.

He doesnâ€™t need help climbing down.
He needs connection before the day swept us apart.

3 mindset shifts that transformed our mornings (and my leadership):

1ï¸âƒ£ Think about â€œdemandsâ€ as invitations
â€œHeâ€™s depending on me againâ€ becomes â€œHeâ€™s trusting me with his first moments.â€

2ï¸âƒ£ Stop being efficient, be present
Instead of rushing through the morning, we slow down to connect. A five-minute conversation beats five extra minutes of sleep any day.

3ï¸âƒ£ Let them express themselves
His pancakes may look like a burnt snowman. We high-five it anyway.

This weekend, try this:
1. Ask: â€œWhatâ€™s the â€˜castle bedâ€™ moment Iâ€™ve been resisting?â€
(A repetitive task? A relationship friction?)
2. Change the script: â€œHow could this become a connection ritual instead?â€

Sam Altman just made a big mistake. He built an AI SDR. 



Itâ€™s not that the technology piece wonâ€™t workâ€¦ it will.

The limitation of building an AI SDR is the psychology of the prospect, not the technology of the sender.

Remember when Hi {{first_name}} skyrocketed open rate from 35% to over 70%!?

You know what the effect is of {{first_name}} today? Negligible.

The same applies to job changes, and fundraising. Those strategies are dying! Why?

Because the first people who did it, it was unique, it was cool! Made the prospect feel good!

Now you change jobs and 163 companies email you about it.

Now you raise funds and 2849 companies email you about it.

The prospect simply thinks â€œthis is so annoyingâ€

Replies might stay high, but theyâ€™re more like â€œno thanksâ€ and â€œgo awayâ€ than â€œimpressive email, letâ€™s chatâ€

Now think about it. Sam Altman created the newest AI SDR, adoption to the moon!

Itâ€™ll likely do the above strategies and more. It means all prospects will now be more quickly annoyed even at VERY PERSONALIZED things.

Email is DEAD, mostly because AI SDRs canâ€™t make phone calls.

Whatever Sam Altman can automate, it will desensitize in the market.

Itâ€™s a hamster wheel, not a race to a finish line. You can run faster and youâ€™re ahead, but just for a bit before the wheel is now turning faster too.

The only way to win with Executives and Leaders is to do what the AI canâ€™t do.

Now stop hereâ€¦. Think for a second, and test out the AI SDRâ€¦ then go do all the things that it canâ€™t do. Thatâ€™s where your competitive advantage lies.

Have fun!

postsData.content:
AI agent for today: automatically writes LinkedIn posts in my voice based on analyzing my last 50 posts.

This one was requested by u/Curious_Irish on Reddit, so I wanted to see how quickly I could build it and whether it would work. The answer: about 10 minutes and yes.

Here's how it works:

The agent analyzes my past LinkedIn posts with high engagement to learn my writing style, topics, and patterns. It looks at things like:
- Post structure and formatting
- Common phrases and language
- Topics that resonate with my audience
- What drives comments and reactions

Then when I give it a content idea, it drafts a post that matches my natural writing voice while incorporating what's worked well for me historically.

Let me know if you're interested in checking it out and I'll make a quick template and demo video.

p.s. other than the intro, this post was written (with very light editing) by this AI agent

Edit: there's a bit of a fun debate going on in the comments:
- Most people think this is a cool idea and want to try it
- A few think this is some combination of evil and lazy

Here's how I think about it:

From my POV, AI-assisted writing is pretty similar to something we've all done for many years:
- we have an idea
- we give the idea to someone on our team or a contractor to create a first draft
- we take that draft and edit it until it we're happy with it

If the initial idea and the final presentation aren't human and compelling, then the outcome will be the AI slop we've all seen. But if they are, you can get to high quality output way faster :)

We all just now have the luxury of a teammate that's really good and really fast!

Donâ€™t panic with, â€œLet me talk to my manager, Iâ€™m sure we can do something for you if you sign by end of quarter.â€

Do take time to understand the objection, take the conversation back to value, and find a mutually beneficial path forward.

postsData.content:
A firestorm of debate has ignited in India since I walked off a podcast due to the poor air quality.

When in India, I ended a podcast early due to the bad air quality. Nikhil Kamathcio was a gracious host and we were having a great time. The problem was that the room we were in circulated outside air which made the air purifier I'd brought with me ineffective.

Inside, the AQI was 130 and PM2.5 was 75 Âµg/mÂ³, which is equal to smoking 3.4 cigarettes for 24 hours of exposure.

This was my third day in India and the air pollution had made my skin break out in rash and my eyes and throat burn.

Air pollution has been so normalized in India that no one even notices anymore despite the science of its negative effects being well known. People would be outside running. Babies and small children exposed from birth. No one wore a mask which can significantly decrease exposure. It was so confusing.

The evidence shows that India would improve the health of its population more by cleaning up air quality than by curing all cancers.

I am unsure why India's leaders do not make air quality a national emergency. I don't know what interests, money and power keep things the way they are but it's really bad for the entire country.

When I returned to the U.S., my eyes were fresh to see what is normalized to me. I saw obesity everywhere. 42.4% of American are obese and because I was around it all the time, I had been mostly oblivious to it.

In many contexts, obesity is worse than air pollution in the long term.

Why wouldn't American leaders declare a national emergency on obesity? What interests, money and power keep things the way they are but are really bad for the entire country.

postsData.content:
The Untapped Power of "I Don't Know"
We live in a world that glorifies having all the answers. From job interviews to casual conversations, there's often pressure to appear knowledgeable and competent. But what if I told you that one of the most powerful phrases you can use is "I don't know"?
Think about it. Admitting you don't know something isn't a sign of weakness; it's a sign of strength. It demonstrates:
Humility: Acknowledging the limits of your knowledge shows self-awareness and a willingness to learn. It makes you more approachable and relatable.
Openness to Learning: Saying "I don't know" opens the door to discovery. It invites others to share their expertise, creating opportunities for collaboration and growth.
Honesty and Integrity: It's far more damaging to pretend you know something when you don't. Honesty builds trust, and trust is essential in any relationship, personal or professional.
Opportunity for Growth: "I don't know" is the first step on the path to learning. It prompts you to seek out information, ask questions, and expand your understanding.
So, the next time you're faced with a question you can't answer, don't be afraid to say those three little words. You might be surprised at the positive impact they have. Embrace the unknown, and watch your knowledge and confidence grow.
What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences in the comments!
postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Embracing I dont know fosters collaboration and growth. Its a powerful tool for continuous learning in todays fast-paced world!
